page.title: 01West Ashby, a brief history.
page.content: West Ashby is a parish and agricultural village situated on the river Waring and straddles the A153 road from Horncastle, 2 miles to the south, to Louth 11 miles to the north It includes the hamlet of Middlethorpe and Farthorpe, a third hamlet - Northorpe was a plague village and an area called Furzehills now ocupies the site. The soil is light loam,subsoil and white clay. The chief crops are wheat, barley, and oats; and more recently contract peas and oil seed rape. The population has fallen, having been 297 in 1801, 391 in 1831, 534 in 1841, 490 in 1881, 283 in 1921, 262 in 1961, 163 electors in 1975 and 185 electors in 1985.In the Domesday Book W.Ashby is refered to as "Aschbei" and apparently belonged to William Conqueror himself.
